traceability.evidence: - test/cli.check-mode.test.js: verifies exit codes 0, 1, and 2 in --check mode across table, JSON, and XML formats (all 6 tests passed). - test/cli.upToDate.test.js: exit code 0 when no updates available in default mode. - test/cli.outdated.test.js: exit code 1 when safe updates are available in default mode. - test/cli.error-cmd.test.js: exit code 2 when npm outdated output is invalid JSON. - Functional assessment (test/functional-assessment.test.js): includes entry for 012.0-DEV-EXIT-CODE-REFINEMENT and passed. - bin/dry-aged-deps.js: implements process.exit(0/1) for no updates/updates and process.exit(2) on errors consistently across formats. - README.md and docs/api.md: contain documented exit codes with correct semantics.
traceability.notes: The specification for standardized exit codes (0=no updates, 1=updates available, 2=error) is fully implemented. Dedicated tests cover all scenarios (no updates, updates, errors), consistency across formats, and invalid inputs. Documentation and CLI help text also reflect the exit code definitions as required.
